'''Armen Dzigarkhanyan''' ({{lang-hy|Ô±ÖÕ´Õ¥Õ¶ ÕÕ«Õ£Õ¡ÖÕ­Õ¡Õ¶ÕµÕ¡Õ¶}}, {{lang-ru|ÐÑÐ¼ÐµÌÐ½ ÐÐ¾ÑÐ¸ÌÑÐ¾Ð²Ð¸Ñ ÐÐ¶Ð¸Ð³Ð°ÑÑ Ð°Ð½ÑÌÐ½}}, born 3 October 1935, [[Yerevan]], [[Armenian Soviet Socialist Republic|Armenian SSR]], [[Soviet Union|USSR]]) is one of the most popular [[Soviet Union|Soviet]], [[Russia]]n and [[Armenia]]n actors. [[File:Armen Jigarhanian.jpeg|thumb|192px| 2010 ]]
He starred in dozens of Soviet films (such as ''[[The Elusive Avengers]]'' and many others) and provided the voice for many cartoon characters. He founded his own theater in [[Moscow]].
Dzigarkhanyan worked as assistant cameraman at [[Armenfilm]] studios in 1953â1954. He began his acting career in 1955 at the Russian Stanislavsky Theater in [[Yerevan]], and in 1967 moved to the [[Lenkom Theatre]] in [[Moscow]].
In 1969, he joined the [[Mayakovsky Academic Theater]]. Dzhigarkhanyan was awarded the Armenian Republican State Prize in 1975 for ''Triangle'' and again in 1979 for ''Snow in Mourning''. He appeared as a chief [[gangster]] in the 1979 TV series ''[[The Meeting Place Cannot Be Changed]]'', playing opposite [[Vladimir Vysotsky]]'s police investigator.
In 1981, he plays a leading role as [[Nazi]] Max Richard in an international Cast ([[Claude Jade]], [[Alain Delon]] and [[Curd JÃ¼rgens]]) in Russian-French Movie ''[[Teheran 43]]''.
Dzigarkhanyan was given the title of [[People's Artist of the USSR]] in 1985.
He has appeared in more than 170 films, according to IMDb. This does not include TV series, voice works and uncredited appearances. Some suggest the real figure is over 200 films.
==Selected filmography== ; Actor * ''[[Hello, That's Me!]]'' (1966) * ''[[The New Adventures of the Elusive Avengers]]'' (1968) * ''[[The Crown of the Russian Empire, or Once Again the Elusive Avengers]]'' (1971) * ''[[Hello, I'm Your Aunt!]]'' (1975) * ''[[The Meeting Place Cannot Be Changed]]'' (1979) * ''[[Teheran 43]]'' (1981)
; Voice * ''[[Once Upon a Dog]]'' (1982) â ''The Wolf'' * ''[[Formula of Love]]'' (1984) â ''Count Cagliostro'' * ''[[Treasure Island (1988 film)|Treasure Island]]'' (1988) â ''John Silver''
